sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"缺乏，不足"之意。
means: lack ： 普通用词，指部分或完全的不足。
want ： 指完全或短缺某物，侧重缺少之物是必需的东西。使用范围比lack窄些。
absence ： 指某物根本不存在或完全短缺，或某人虽存在，但未到现场。
shortage ： 指不足，但侧重达不到规定的，需要的或已知应有的数量。
scarcity ： 指产量不足或缺乏某物难以应付或满足需要。

sentence.Network_en: The water shortage in this country is potentially catastrophic.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个国家的水资源匮乏可能会带来灾难性的后果。

sentence.Network_en: A shortage of funds is preventing the UN from monitoring relief.
sentence.Network_cn: 资金短缺使联合国无法督导救援工作。

sentence.Network_en: Patients were dying because of an acute shortage of nurses.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为护理人员严重不足，患者生命垂危。

entry.def: If there is a shortage of something, there is not enough of it.

example.ex: A shortage of funds is preventing the UN from monitoring relief...
example.tran: 资金短缺使联合国无法督导救援工作。

example.ex: Vietnam is suffering from food shortage...
example.tran: 越南正遭受食物短缺之苦。

means.word_mean: 1. the property of being an amount by which something is less than expected or required

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 名词或动词后缀,表示"状态,总称"; 2. [做的]状态,过程; 3. 名词后缀,表示"费用"; 4. 名词后缀,表示"场所,物品"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dam+age状态,总称→n.损害,伤害
carry携带,运送+age费用→carriage运费
post邮件+age费用→n.邮资
rail铁路+age费用→n.铁路运输,铁路运费
tow拖+age费用→n.拖[船,车]费
water水+age费用→n.水路运输,水运费
anchor铁锚+age场所,物品→n.停泊地点;抛锚地点
append附加+age表示名词→n.附加物
bever饮,喝+age场所,物品→n.[水,酒等之外的]饮料
cot小床,小屋+age场所→cottage村舍,小屋
herit继承+age场所,物品→n.遗产,继承物;传统
hermit隐居士+age场所,物品→n.隐居处
lug拖拉+age物品→需要拖运的物品→luggage行李,皮箱
vill茅屋+age场所,物品→n.村,村庄
wreck残骸+age场所,物品→n.残骸,碎片

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优点,长处,有利条件;利益,好处
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad+vant=van前卫,先锋+age状态,总称→n.优点,长处,有利条件;利益,好处
dot打点,打盹+age状态,总称→n.老年糊涂,溺爱
drain排干+age状态,总称→n.排水;下水道
foli叶+age状态,总称→n.叶子[总称]
marry结婚+age状态,总称→marriage
mile英里+age状态,总称→n.里程
patron赞助人+age状态,总称→n.赞助,惠顾
percent百分比+age状态,总称→n.百分率
pilgrim朝圣+age状态,总称→n.朝圣
short短+age状态,总称→n.不足,缺乏
ton吨+age状态,总称→tonnage吨位
verbi=verb词语+age状态,总称→词的状态→冗长
vis看+age状态,总称→n.脸,面貌
pill抢夺+age状态,总称→n.&v.抢劫,掠夺
en进入+vis看+age[做的]状态→进入看的状态

Sentence.sentence: But as the nursing shortage worsens, a growing number of schools and hospitals are establishing "fast-track programs" that enable college graduates with no nursing experience to become registered nurses with only a year or so of specialized training.
Short-term oil shortage drove American consumers to wait in long lines at gas pumps.
The government also established a stockpile (贮存) of oil as a short-term buffer (缓冲) against future shortages.
In many countries immigrants have been filling such gaps in the labour force as have already emerged (and remember that the real shortage is still around ten years off).

jushi.english: There was a shortage of skilled workers.
There is no shortage of things to do in the town.
